channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judges Keep Restrictions on Los Angeles Immigration Arrests
item.description: An appellate panel upheld a finding that federal agents appeared to rely exclusively on race and other factors, such as speaking Spanish, in making ar...

item.title: A vacancy on the Fed is opening early as Trump urges board to ‘assume control’ if Powell doesn’t cut rates
item.description: The 12 voting members of the FOMC make interest rate decisions based on a simple majority vote.

item.title: Jeannie Seely, Who Pushed Boundaries and Broke Hearts at the Grand Ole Opry, Dies at 85
item.description: She blazed a trail for women in country music with the candor of her songs and her bold fashion sense. She was the first woman to host a segment on th...

item.title: 4 Dead in Anaconda, Montana, Bar Shooting; Police Search for Gunman
item.description: Law enforcement officials engaged in a growing manhunt for the suspect, who lived close to the bar. They warned that he was believed to be armed.

item.title: A Bid to Undo a Colonial-Era Wrong Touches a People’s Old Wounds
item.description: An Oxford museum’s collection of objects taken from the Naga people includes human remains. What to do with them now is not a simple matter.

item.title: After D.C. Plane Crash, Air Traffic Controllers Were Not Tested for Alcohol
item.description: The F.A.A. has since been training on-call specialists to be snappier about administering alcohol and drug tests after a serious incident, an official...

item.title: In Delhi and New York, Hindu Right Wing Lines Up Against Mamdani
item.description: As Zohran Mamdani gets within striking distance of becoming New York’s first Muslim mayor, he is drawing fire from supporters of India’s populist prim...

item.title: A Bid to Undo a Colonial-Era Wrong Touches a People’s Old Wounds
item.description: An Oxford museum’s collection of objects taken from the Naga people includes human remains. What to do with them now is not a simple matter.

item.title: Why Trump’s Tariffs Are Closing Factories in Lesotho
item.description: The closure of a factory in the small southern African nation of Lesotho is an early effect of the global disruption caused by President Trump’s tarif...

item.title: Photos From a Gaza Airdrop
item.description: A photographer accompanied a Jordanian aircrew as it dropped aid to Gaza, where starvation is rising.

item.title: Economy Updates: After a Weak Jobs Report, Trump Fires That Agency’s Commissioner
item.description: Hours after data showed cracks in the U.S. economy, President Trump said without evidence that Erika McEntarfer “rigged” the data “to make the Republi...

item.title: Shockingly bad jobs report reveals a monthslong stall and may trigger Fed rate cuts soon. ‘Powell is going to regret holding rates steady’
item.description: “September is a lock for a rate cut, and it might even be a 50-basis-point move to make up the lost time.”

item.title: Everyone’s watching Jerome Powell as warnings flash for the U.S. economy
item.description: “The July jobs report goes a long way toward providing the evidence of a weaker labor market that the Fed needs to justify cutting interest rates in t...

item.title: Coinbase’s $1.5 billion windfall—and two other key numbers hidden in latest earnings
item.description: The “one-time” items like the Circle payout and the $307 million data breach are more significant than the quarterly revenue and trading figures.

item.title: Dow tumbles more than 500 points as job numbers shock Wall Street and tariff ‘panic’ sets in
item.description: Trump, meanwhile, continues to beat the drum against Fed chair Jerome Powell.
